Docs.summary: Represents a column header for a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A GridViewColumnHeader object is a button control that is derived from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase>. GridViewColumnHeader properties keep track of mouse events and the resizing of columns.
Column headers in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> view mode are GridViewColumnHeader objects.
You can customize GridViewColumnHeader objects by using a variety of properties that are found in this class and in related classes. For more information about these properties, and about the precedence between them, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A GridViewColumnHeader is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl>, which means that it can contain a single object of any type (such as a string, an image, or a panel). For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl> class.
## Examples Each GridViewColumnHeader can contain a context (right-click) menu. The following example shows how to create a context menu for a GridViewColumnHeader in XAML.
[!code-xml[ListViewCode#HeaderContextMenu](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/ListViewCode/Window1.xaml#headercontextmenu)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader.Role%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader> and updates the floating version of the header when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader.Role%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeaderRole>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnClick() cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the event for a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation does not raise the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.Click> event when a column is changing its position.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer OnCreateAutomationPeer() cil managed
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnLostKeyboardFocus(class System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the event for a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader> implementation of <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnLostKeyboardFocus%2A> clears mouse capture.
This implementation does not change the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseEnter(class System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the event when the user pauses the mouse pointer on the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation handles the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseEnter> event when the user drags a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader> and its column to a new location in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> by using the mouse. To handle the event, the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs> is set to `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseLeave(class System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the event when the mouse moves off the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation handles the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeave> event when the user drags a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader> with the mouse from its old location, to move the header and its column. To handle the event, the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs> is set to `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseLeftButtonDown(class System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the event when the user presses the left mouse button while pausing the mouse pointer on the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation handles the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonUp> event so that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.OnMouseLeftButtonUp%2A?displayProperty=fullName> can support the drag-and-drop operation that moves a column. This method captures the mouse and sets the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> event argument to `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseLeftButtonUp(class System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the event when the user releases the left mouse button while pausing the mouse pointer on the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This implementation handles the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonUp> event (which occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property in the <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs> is set to `true`). It also ends the mouse capture that was set by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader.OnMouseLeftButtonDown%2A> method. This provides a way for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.OnMouseLeftButtonUp%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to support the drag-and-drop operation that moves a column.
This method sets the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> event argument to `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseMove(class System.Windows.Input.MouseEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the event that occurs when the user moves the mouse within a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This implementation keeps the left mouse button in a pressed state while a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn> is moved by a drag-and-drop operation. This also causes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.IsPressed%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader> to remain set to `true` when the mouse with its left mouse button pressed moves off the header.
This implementation keeps the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> event argument set to `false` for the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseMove> event so that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewHeaderRowPresenter.OnMouseMove%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method can support the drag-and-drop operation that moves a column.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance void OnRenderSizeChanged(class System.Windows.SizeChangedInfo sizeInfo) cil managed

Docs.param: Information about the change in the size of the .
Docs.summary: Responds to a change in dimensions.

Docs.value: A enumeration value that specifies the current role of the column.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The class performs layout for the column headers in a and places an additional column header at the end to add space. A Role value of identifies this column header in the . A Role value of identifies a column that is currently the object of a drag-and-drop operation. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

remarks.format: ## Remarks The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumnHeader.Role%2A> dependency property.

- <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplateProperty>
- <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.ContentTemplateSelectorProperty>
- <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ContextMenuProperty>

- <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ToolTipProperty>
